org.mundo.net.transport.ip
Class IPLink

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.net.transport.TransportLink
      org.mundo.net.transport.ip.IPLink

public class IPLink
extends TransportLink

Describes an IP-based link to an adjacent peer.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler

Constructor Detail

IPLink

public IPLink(IPTransportService s,
              int pr)

IPLink

public IPLink(IPTransportService s,
              java.net.InetSocketAddress a,
              int pr)
Initializes a new IP link.

Parameters:
s - the transport service that owns this route.
a - the peer's external address.
pr - the protocol: PROTO_TCP or PROTO_UDP.

public void set(java.net.InetSocketAddress a,

Initializes this route with the specified peer address and port and generates the metric value based on this information.

getService

Returns the associated transport service owning this route.

Specified by:

getConnection

public ITransportConnection getConnection()
Returns the connection object associated with this route.

Specified by:
getConnection in class TransportLink

getPeerExtAddress

public java.net.InetSocketAddress getPeerExtAddress()
Returns the peer's external address. This is the address under which the peer is visible to us. In case of NAT, the peer's external and internal addresses may be different.

getPeerIntAddress

public java.net.InetSocketAddress getPeerIntAddress()
Returns the peer's internal address. This is the address of the peer behind NAT, if there is any.

getLocalExtAddress

public java.net.InetSocketAddress getLocalExtAddress()
Returns the local external address. This is the address of this node as it appears to the peer.

setLocalExtAddress

public void setLocalExtAddress(java.net.InetSocketAddress a)

getProto

public int getProto()
Returns the protocol. One of PROTO_TCP or PROTO_UDP.

isLoopback

public boolean isLoopback()
Checks if the remote address is a loopback address.

Returns:
true if the remote address is a loopback address; false otherwise.

isPrimary

public boolean isPrimary()
Checks if one end of the route is a primary port on the local host.

Returns:
true if one end of the route is a primary port on the local host; or false otherwise.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Converts this object to a string representation.
